summary: Email correspondence between Assistant U.S. Attorney and defense attorney Roy Black regarding the sealed '9124107 agreement' related to Jeffrey Epstein's plea deal. The email discusses opposing disclosure of the agreement in civil cases and coordinating document filings.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Defense attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein's interests, coordinating with the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding the sealed plea agreement and opposing its disclosure in civil cases.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Mentioned as someone who should send an exact copy of what was filed under seal in state court to ensure all parties have the same documents.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the correspondence; his plea agreement and the sealed '9124107 agreement' are being discussed between defense counsel and the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Roy Black is acting as defense counsel for Jeffrey Epstein, communicating with prosecutors about the plea agreement.
Roy Black references Jack Goldberger as someone who should provide documents, suggesting they are part of the same legal team or working together.

events.title: Plea Agreement and Sealed Filing
events.description: Reference to a plea agreement and a specific '9124107 agreement' filed under seal in state court as part of obligations to disclose promises or inducements related to Jeffrey Epstein's plea.

keyFacts: A sealed document referred to as the '9124107 agreement' was filed in state court as part of Jeffrey Epstein's plea deal.
Defense attorney Roy Black and the U.S. Attorney's Office are coordinating to oppose disclosure of this agreement in civil cases.
There is concern among defense counsel that civil lawyers might publicize the agreement to attract more plaintiffs.
The correspondence confirms that Epstein and his counsel intend to stand by their agreements with prosecutors.
